Detailed Description

Constants and helpers for the Infos table, which contains details for individual infos.

The following example demonstrates how to use the CalendarInfos

 MyPage::onInit(Persistence* const savedInstanceState) {
     // new Context instance
     Context* context = new Context(this);

     // new CalendarInfos
     CalendarInfos infos(*context);

     //add value
     ContentValues cv;
     cv.addValue(CalendarInfos::Calendars::ALLOWED_REMINDERS(), 1);
     infos.add(CalendarInfos::CALENDARS_URI(), cv);

     //set value
     ContentValues cv2;
     cv2.addValue(CalendarInfos::Calendars::CAN_MODIFY_TIME_ZONE(), 1);
     infos.set(CalendarInfos::CALENDARS_URI(), cv2, "_ID=0", NULL);

     //get value
     Cursor* results = infos.getN(CalendarInfos::CALENDARS_URI(),
         NULL,
         CalendarInfos::Calendars::ALLOWED_REMINDERS() + "=1",
         NULL,
         NULL);

     if (results != NULL && results->moveToFirst()) {
         do {
             String accountName = results->getString(0);
             // ...do something
         } while (results->moveToNext());
     }

     //remove value
     infos.remove(CalendarInfos::CALENDARS_URI(), "_ID=0", NULL);

     delete results;
     delete context;
 }

Definition at line 76 of file CalendarInfos.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum gaia::content::CalendarInfos::CalendarAccessLevels

Calendar Access Level default levels.

Enumerator:
CAL_ACCESS_NONE 

Cannot access the calendar.

CAL_ACCESS_FREEBUSY 

Can only see free/busy information about the calendar.

CAL_ACCESS_READ 

Can read all event details.

CAL_ACCESS_RESPOND 

Can reply yes/no/maybe to an event.

CAL_ACCESS_OVERRIDE 

not used

CAL_ACCESS_CONTRIBUTOR 

Full access to modify the calendar, but not the access control settings.

CAL_ACCESS_EDITOR 

Full access to modify the calendar, but not the access settings.

CAL_ACCESS_OWNER 

Full access to the calendar.

CAL_ACCESS_ROOT 

Domain admin.

Definition at line 428 of file CalendarInfos.h.

enum gaia::content::CalendarInfos::CalendarColorTypes

Default values of Colors::COLOR_TYPE.

Enumerator:
TYPE_CALENDAR 

This indicateds a color that can be used for calendars.

TYPE_EVENT 

This indicates a color that can be used for events.

Definition at line 633 of file CalendarInfos.h.

enum gaia::content::CalendarInfos::CalendarDisplayOrder

Calendar account display order.

Enumerator:
DISPLAY_ORDER_TOP 

This calendar would be display on top position.

DISPLAY_ORDER_EXCHANGE 

Those exchange calendar would be display on last two position.

DISPLAY_ORDER_OUTLOOK 

Those outlook calendar would be display on last one position.

DISPLAY_ORDER_PEOPLE_EVENT 

Those people event calendar would be display on last position.

Member Function Documentation

static const base::String gaia::content::CalendarInfos::ACCOUNT_TYPE_LOCAL ( ) [static]

A special account type for calendars not associated with any account.

Normally calendars that do not match an account on the device will be removed. Setting the account_type on a calendar to this will prevent it from being wiped if it does not match an existing account.

See also:
CalendarInfos::Calendars::ACCOUNT_TYPE

static const base::String gaia::content::CalendarInfos::CALLER_IS_SYNCADAPTER ( ) [static]

An optional insert, update or delete URI parameter that allows the caller to specify that it is a sync adapter.

The default value is false. If set to true, the modified row is not marked as "dirty" (needs to be synced) and when the provider calls core::ContentResolver#notifyChange(const gaia::net::Uri&, const gaia::storage::ContentObserver*) , the third parameter "syncToNetwork" is set to false. Furthermore, if set to true, the caller must also include CalendarInfos::Calendars#ACCOUNT_NAME and CalendarInfos::Calendars#ACCOUNT_TYPE as query parameters.

See also:
net::UriBuilder::appendQueryParameter(const base::String&, const base::String&)
storage::Cursor* gaia::content::CalendarInfos::getN ( const net::Uri &  uri,
base::StringArray *const  selection,
base::String *const  where,
base::StringArray *const  whereArgs,
base::String *const  sort 
)

Query the given table, returning a Cursor over the result set.

Parameters:
uriThe requested uri.
selectionA list of which columns to return. Passing NULL will return all columns, which is discouraged to prinfo reading data from storage that isn't going to be used.
whereA filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing NULL will return all rows for the given table.
whereArgsYou may include ?s in where, which will be replaced by the values from whereArgs, in order that they appear in the where. The values will be bound as StringArray.
sortHow to order the rows, formatted as an SQL ORDER BY clause (excluding the ORDER BY itself). Passing NULL will use the default sort order, which may be unordered.
Returns:
A Cursor object, which is positioned before the first entry. Note that Cursors are not synchronized, see the documentation for more details.

Returns:
The number of rows affected if a whereClause is passed in, 0 otherwise. To remove all rows and get a count pass "1" as the whereClause.
